Package jetbrains.exodus.io

Interface DataReader

  • public interface DataReader
    DataReader defines basic structure of Log. DataReader provides access to all blocks or groups of successive blocks in the log.
    Since:
    1.3.0
    See Also:
    Block, DataWriter, DataReaderWriterProvider

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void close()
      Closes DataReader and all open resources associated with it (files, connections, etc.).
      @NotNull java.lang.Iterable<Block> getBlocks()
      Returns all Log blocks sorted by address.
      @NotNull java.lang.Iterable<Block> getBlocks​(long fromAddress)
      Returns blocks sorted by address with address greater than or equal to specified fromAddress.
      @NotNull java.lang.String getLocation()
      Returns Log location how it was passed as a parameter to DataReaderWriterProvider.newReaderWriter(String).

    • Method Detail

      • getLocation

        @NotNull
@NotNull java.lang.String getLocation()
        Returns Log location how it was passed as a parameter to DataReaderWriterProvider.newReaderWriter(String).
        Returns:
        location how it was passed as a parameter to DataReaderWriterProvider.newReaderWriter(String)
        See Also:
        DataReaderWriterProvider.newReaderWriter(String)

      • getBlocks

        @NotNull
@NotNull java.lang.Iterable<Block> getBlocks()
        Returns all Log blocks sorted by address.
        Returns:
        blocks sorted by address
        See Also:
        Block, Block.getAddress()

      • getBlocks

        @NotNull
@NotNull java.lang.Iterable<Block> getBlocks​(long fromAddress)
        Returns blocks sorted by address with address greater than or equal to specified fromAddress.
        Parameters:
        fromAddress - starting block address
        Returns:
        blocks sorted by address
        See Also:
        Block, Block.getAddress()

      • close

        void close()
        Closes DataReader and all open resources associated with it (files, connections, etc.). After the DataReader is closed, any block got using getBlocks() or getBlocks(long) method would be no longer accessible.
        See Also:
        Block, getBlocks(), getBlocks(long)
